page.title: 08LOCAL NEWS
page.content: A hamster called Earthquake not surprizingly won the prize for the pet with the most unusual name in the pet show at the Chiddingly school fayre. Flake the lamb was another pet which raised 400 pounds for school funds. The unseasonal weather did not deter 300 people from enjoying such attractions as strawberries and cream, musical rides and side shows. There was also entertainment from the East Sussex Youth Concert Band. The most popular event was the BMX competition on a specially built track. A young man of 16 years won the Chris Pelling Trophy for the Â£Grand Canyon Jump'. Also school pupils gave displays of almost long forgotten traditional dances such as the Barber's Pole and the Spider's Web !
